title: Use Quotient rule to evaluate of a derivative

content.question: The table above gives values for the functions f and g and their derivatives at <math> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </math>. Let k be the function given by <math> <mrow> <mi>k</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>, where <math> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>≠</mo> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> </math>. What is the value of <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>k</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>?</mo> </mrow> </math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
